title: How to Make Apricot and Coconut Seed Balls

steps.headline: Chop the apricots and prunes finely.
In a small bowl, beat the cream cheese with an electric mixer, or by hand with a whisk, until smooth.
Stir in the chopped apricots and prunes and mix well.
steps.description: Add the apricot jam and mixed chopped seeds. Mix all ingredients together to thoroughly blend.

steps.headline: Place the blended mixture in the refrigerator.
steps.description: Leave for about half an hour, or until the mixture becomes hard enough to roll together.

steps.headline: Remove from the refrigerator.
steps.description: Roll into small balls of about 2 tbsp worth of mixture each.

steps.headline: Roll the completed balls in a bowl of coconut and set out on a stick-proof tray to firm in the refrigerator.
Allow to firm for at least 15 minutes.
steps.description: If you are keeping these for longer, keep in an airtight container to preserve the taste.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: These can be eaten as fruit balls but they are also delicious sandwiched between two savoury crackers.

text: Chop the apricots and prunes finely.  In a small bowl, beat the cream cheese with an electric mixer, or by hand with a whisk, until smooth.  Stir in the chopped apricots and prunes and mix well. Add the apricot jam and mixed chopped seeds. Mix all ingredients together to thoroughly blend. Place the blended mixture in the refrigerator. Leave for about half an hour, or until the mixture becomes hard enough to roll together. Remove from the refrigerator. Roll into small balls of about 2 tbsp worth of mixture each. Roll the completed balls in a bowl of coconut and set out on a stick-proof tray to firm in the refrigerator.  Allow to firm for at least 15 minutes. If you are keeping these for longer, keep in an airtight container to preserve the taste. Serve. These can be eaten as fruit balls but they are also delicious sandwiched between two savoury crackers. Finished.
